quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Ghost and Number
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, boleyns, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Ghosts have taken a significant place in literature and art since this period.

There are countless theories about the origins of fear of number 13. One says that the phobia comes from Norse mythology. According to a legend, the 13th god, the god of mischief, turned up at a gathering of the 12 Viking gods and caused the death of Balder the Good.  What was the god of mischief called?
The fear of the fatal date is called this.
A ghost is a supernatural entity thought to be the spirit of a person remaining on Earth after their death to seek revenge.
There is something specific about Anne Boleyns ghost. What is it?

options.text: She does not have a ghost.
Her ghost is without a head.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Her ghost is without a head.

questions.question: Brad Pitt starred in all these movies, except one. Can you spot it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Beach

questions.question: Is there a difference between a poltergeist and a ghost?
Robin Williams starred in Mrs. Doubtfire. Another great actor, Dustin Hoffman starred in Tootsie. Both characters pretended to be this.
The Epic of Gilgamesh is the oldest written story, containing a lot of references to the spirits of the dead.

In 1993 an interesting study about Friday the 13th was published in the British Medical Journal. Its authors investigated if this mystical date is really dangerous. They compared the ratio of traffic volume to the number of vehicular accidents on two different days throughout several years. What was the conclusion of the study?

options.text: The number of vehicular accidents is lower on Friday the 13th
Friday the 13th doesnt have any affect on the number of vehicular accidents
Friday the 13th actually affects the number of vehicular accidents

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Friday the 13th actually affects the number of vehicular accidents

questions.question: What does Suetonius, Geoffrey of Monmouth and Herodotus have in common?

options.text: They are three writers that produce modern urban legends.
They are three writers that produced the first urban legends.
They are three ghost from the modern urban legends.
They are three ghosts from the first urban legends.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are three writers that produced the first urban legends.

questions.question: Chinese people believe that 13 is a lucky number.
Which of the following statements about ghosts is incorrect?

options.text: They are always depicted of a human size and shape.
Ghosts do not have a gross physical body.
Sometimes they might manifest their presence by moving other objects or producing noises.
They are usually portrayed as silvery, shadowy and fog-like.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are always depicted of a human size and shape.

questions.question: The ghost of the Roman Emperor Caligula was said to haunt this place.

options.text: Basilica di San Giovanni in Laterano

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Lamian Gardens of Rome

questions.question: People fear Friday for many reasons. For example, Jesus Christ was crucified on Friday, the Great Flood began on Friday and Adam and Eve were banned from the Garden of Eden on Friday. Do you know what type of day Friday was in the pagan Roman empire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Execution day

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Movie and 13th
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, stars. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Most estate agents find it difficult to sell a house, numbered thirteen.
In Pretty in Pink, the character played by Molly Ringwald has a guest, named Long Duk Dong, who is a  foreign exchange student.
What movie stars George Peppard as a WWI ace pilot?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Blue Max

questions.question: What was unique about The Green Berets, a film starring John Wayne?

options.text: It was John Waynes first movie without a female co-star
It was the only non-western John Wayne movie in color
It was the only Vietnam War film that was produced during the war itself

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was the only Vietnam War film that was produced during the war itself

questions.question: Having in mind the mysterious background of Black Friday, it is quite natural that the TV series Friday the 13th were so popular. The main character, Jason, is one of the biggest celebrities in the world of horror movies. What is Jasons family name?
In White Men Cant Jump, Sidney Deane, played by Wesley Snipes is married to Rosie Perez character, Gloria Clemente.
Which 1985 comedy film starred Tom Hanks, Jim Belushi and Lori Singer?

options.text: The Man With One Red Shoe
The Masque of the Red Death

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Man With One Red Shoe

questions.question: Female drivers have more traffic accidents on Friday the 13th.
In the movie Goldfinger, which one of the following characters does not die?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pussy Galore

questions.question: In Black Sunday, Michael Lander played by Bruce Dern, conspires with a Palestinian terrorist group to kill masses of innocent people in what way?

options.text: by detonating a nuclear device inside the Pentagon
by detonating a bomb, housed in the undercarriage of a blimp, over a football stadium during the Super Bowl
by hijacking a 747 and taking it to Syria
by infecting a water supply with the black plague

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: by detonating a bomb, housed in the undercarriage of a blimp, over a football stadium during the Super Bowl

questions.question: Actors Patrick Swayze, Jennifer Gray, Charlie Sheen and C.Thomas Howell played in both Red Dawn and The Outsiders.
Over any given 400-year cycle the 13th day of the month occurs 4800 times. The 13th most often falls on this day of the week.
In the film The Hunt For Red October, what was the unique quality of the Russian submarine Red October?

options.text: It was a laser guided sub that tracks 24 targets at the same time.
It was built with a revolutionary stealth propulsion system called the caterpillar drive,
Its stealth armor confuses the enemy sonar

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was built with a revolutionary stealth propulsion system called the caterpillar drive,

questions.question: The bad name of both Friday and number 13 can be explained by many historical and religious facts. However, the reason why they are linked together to form this powerful superstition, cant be explained so easily. According to one theory, the ill-fame of Friday 13th dates back to 13 October 1307, when King Philip IV of France arrested most of the knights of one famous Order. What was the name of the Order?

options.text: The Ancient and Illustrious Order Knights of Malta
Ancient Order Knights of the Mystic Chain

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Knights Templar

questions.question: This movie, directed by Stanley Kubrick, stars Malcolm McDowell as Alex DeLarge.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Clockwork Orange

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Hair and History
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, college, rrc. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Most fairy tale characters have this color hair.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marilyn Monroe

questions.question: Three of the following albums are by the band Red Hot Chili Peppers. Which is the odd one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In Another Land

questions.question: Researchers in England found this to be true of  blond cashiers in supermarkets.

options.text: Have frequent technical issues with the registers
Have higher chances of not balancing the register at the end of the day

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gather greater queues

questions.question: The hairs of a natural blonde can be described as this.

options.text: More than those of a brunette
Thinner than those of a brunette
The same number as those of a brunette
Fewer than those of a brunette

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: More than those of a brunette

questions.question: The Rothschilds were one of the most successful business families in history. Their family name literally means this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red Shield

questions.question: Red River College (RRC) is a large and very comprehensive institute of applied learning, located in this city.
During The Restoration period blond hair became a symbol of this.
Red is the color of all these except one.
Red is believed to provoke hunger.
The movie Trois couleurs: Rouge (Three Colors: Red) is about a girl who discovers her neighbour is keen on invading peoples privacy. This is her profession.
One of the first known blondes was this Greek goddess, whose hair was described by Homer as golden.
Strange as it may be, there are paintings, depicting a blonde one of her.
Red Lobster is a U.S. chain of seafood restaurants. Its original name was this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harbor for Seafood Lovers

questions.question: Blonde hair was important to Hitler, according to him it symbolized this.

options.text: The purity of the Aryan race

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The purity of the Aryan race

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The remote control locator

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ray Tomlinson

options.text: Each parent contributes 23 chromosomes to the DNA of a child.

All statements are in fact true.
The Knights Templar had 23 Grand Masters, the last being Jacques de Molay.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All statements are in fact true.

options.text: a period of massive extinction of species
